benefits.title: Differences between systematic reviews/meta-analyses of hyaluronic acid/hyaluronan/hylan in osteoarthritis of the knee.
benefits.summary: Hyaluronic acid therapy has moderate evidence for pain reduction and physical function improvement in osteoarthritis of the knee.

benefits.title: Effect of Hyaluronic Acid on Random‐Pattern Flaps in Rats
benefits.summary: Hyaluronic acid had a slight beneficial effect on flap viability, but no significant improvement in flap survival was shown.

benefits.title: Hyaluronic acid. A review of its pharmacology and use as a surgical aid in ophthalmology, and its therapeutic potential in joint disease and wound healing.
benefits.summary: Hyaluronic acid is a well-established adjunct to cataract surgery and may be a promising option in the treatment of osteoarthritis.

benefits.title: Hyaluronic Acid–Based Activatable Nanomaterials for Stimuli‐Responsive Imaging and Therapeutics: Beyond CD44‐Mediated Drug Delivery
benefits.summary: Hyaluronic acid-based nanomaterials can increase therapeutic efficacy and reduce adverse side effects while retaining benefits like active targeting and stimuli-responsive degradation.

benefits.title: Hyaluronic Acid
benefits.summary: Hyaluronic acid is a well-established adjunct to cataract surgery and may prove to be a promising option in the treatment of patients with osteoarthritis.

benefits.title: Hyaluronic Acid and Controlled Release: A Review
benefits.summary: Hyaluronic acid (HA) controlled release systems offer benefits such as optimum drug concentration maintenance, enhanced therapeutic effects, improved treatment efficiency, very low or insignificant toxicity, and prolonged in vivo release rates.

benefits.title: Improvement of hyaluronic acid enzymatic stability by the grafting of amino-acids
benefits.summary: Hyaluronic acid-based hydrogels provide therapeutic benefits and can be modified with amino acids for increased stability and potential use in viscosupplementation or drug delivery.

benefits.title: Hyaluronic acid in ankle osteoarthritis: why evidence of efficacy is still lacking?
benefits.summary: Hyaluronic acid injections are useful in treating osteoarthritis due to their restoration of elastic and viscous properties of intra-articular fluid, anti-inflammatory and anti-nociceptive activity, and normalization of hyaluronan synthesis and degradation.

benefits.title: gIS HYALURONIC ACID THE PERFECT EXCIPIENT FOR THE PHARMACEUTICAL NEED?
benefits.summary: Hyaluronic acid has beneficial properties like solubility, biocompatibility, and biodegradation, making it a potential excipient for pharmaceutical products.

benefits.title: Evaluation of Intraarterial Thrombolysis in Treatment of Cosmetic Facial Filler-Related Ophthalmic Artery Occlusion.
benefits.summary: Intraarterial thrombolysis therapy is beneficial to patients suffering from blindness induced by hyaluronic acid embolism, alleviating impairment to vision and restoring other serious complications.

side effects.title: Cutaneous Hypersensitivity Reaction to Injectable Hyaluronic Acid Gel
side effects.summary: Injectable hyaluronic acid gel can be associated with severe allergic reactions, such as indurated and erythematous papulocystic nodules at the injection sites.

side effects.title: Acute arthritis after intra-articular hyaluronate injection: onset of effusions without crystal
side effects.summary: Intra-articular hyaluronate injections can cause aseptic acute arthritis within hours after injection, potentially due to calcium crystal shedding or apatite crystals.

side effects.title: Human Anti‐Hyaluronic Acid Antibodies: Is it Possible?
side effects.summary: Some adverse reactions to injectable hyaluronic acid may be allergic reactions, with some patients experiencing chronic inflammatory reactions or severe granulamatous reactions.

side effects.title: Review of long-term adverse effects associated with the use of chemically-modified animal and nonanimal source hyaluronic acid dermal fillers
side effects.summary: Hyaluronic acid-based dermal fillers have a low overall incidence of long-term side effects, but occasionally cause chronic lymphoplasmacytic inflammatory reactions and classic foreign body-type granulomatous reactions.

side effects.title: The Classification and Prognosis of Periocular Complications Related to Blindness following Cosmetic Filler Injection
side effects.summary: Hyaluronic acid filler injections can cause mild side effects like ptosis, ophthalmoplegia, and enophthalmos, but blindness can also occur.

side effects.title: Hypersensitivity reaction to hyaluronic acid dermal filler after the Pfizer vaccination against SARS-CoV-2
side effects.summary: Hyaluronic acid injections may cause delayed-type hypersensitivity reactions, affecting daily life activities.

side effects.title: Near‐Infrared Imaging of Veins in Facial Injection of Botulinum Toxin and Hyaluronic Acid
side effects.summary: Hyaluronic acid injections in facial rejuvenation can cause pain, swelling, erythema, and bruising, but these side effects are limited and benign.

side effects.title: Panophthalmoplegia and vision loss after cosmetic nasal dorsum injection
side effects.summary: Hyaluronic acid injections into the dorsum of the nose can cause unilateral blindness and panophthalmoplegia in extremely rare cases.

side effects.title: Treatment of glabella skin necrosis following injection of hyaluronic acid filler using platelet-rich plasma
side effects.summary: Skin necrosis is a rare but disastrous side effect of hyaluronic acid filler injections, potentially resulting in permanent and disfiguring scarring.
side effects.journal: Journal of Cosmetic and Laser Therapy

side effects.title: Severe Acute Local Reactions to a Hyaluronic Acid-derived Dermal Filler.
side effects.summary: Hyaluronic acid-derived injectable fillers can cause side effects like persistent swelling, pain, and nodule formation.
side effects.journal: The Journal of clinical and aesthetic dermatology

dosage.title: Hyaluronic acid: an effective alternative treatment of interstitial cystitis, recurrent urinary tract infections, and hemorrhagic cystitis?
dosage.summary: Hyaluronic acid was administered intravesically at a dose of 40 mg every week for 4-6 weeks, with patients with noted improvement receiving two additional monthly doses.

dosage.title: Effect of exogenous hyaluronic acid on joint function in experimentally induced equine osteoarthritis: dosage titration studies.
dosage.summary: A single intra-articular injection of 20 or 40 mg of purified hyaluronic acid restored normal joint function in horses with experimentally induced osteoarthritis.

dosage.title: Ocular sustained delivery of prednisolone using hyaluronic acid benzyl ester films
dosage.summary: Hyaluronic acid benzyl ester films can provide sustained delivery of prednisolone to the eye with concentrations between 45 and 72 Î14g/ml for an 8-hour study period.

dosage.title: Effects of the use of hyaluronic acid as compared with standard chondroprotectors therapy in patients with various degrees of gonarthrosis
dosage.summary: Hyaluronic acid "replacement" intraarticular injections with a concentration of 10 mg/ml are the most commonly used therapy for gonarthrosis.

dosage.title: Novel adhesive hyaluronic acid based solid dosage form for pediatric application
dosage.summary: Hyaluronic acid-cysteine ethyl ester was developed for pediatric intraoral use, providing 3.4-fold augmented lubrication in the intraoral cavity.
dosage.journal: Journal of Drug Delivery Science and Technology

dosage.title: EVALUATION OF CHONDROPROTECTIVE EFFECTS OF HYALURONIC ACID IN A RAT MODEL OF OSTEOARTHRITIS
dosage.summary: Intra articular viscosupplementation of 0.2ml hyaluronic acid once weekly for four weeks improved gait pattern and histopathology in a rat model of osteoarthritis.

dosage.title: Hyaluronan (hyaluronic acid) in lung lavage of asbestos-exposed humans and sheep
dosage.summary: BALF hyaluronan averaged 53.9 ± 7.4 ng/ml in human controls, 67.5 ± 10.3 ng/ml in asbestos-exposed workers without asbestosis, and 206 ± 83 ng/ml in workers with asbestosis.

dosage.title: Effects of recombinant human augmenter of liver regeneration on serum hyaluronic acid content in fibrotic rats
dosage.summary: Recombinant hALR may decrease serum hyaluronic acid content in fibrotic rats at dosages of 50/kg per day and 10/kg per day.

dosage.title: The optimal dosage of hyaluronic acid for bone regeneration in rat calvarial defects.
dosage.summary: The 75 mg/mL HA group showed better bone formation than the other groups (1, 25, and 50 mg/mL HA and control).

dosage.title: The effects of hyaluronic acid vaginal gel on the vaginal epithelium of ovariectomized rats
dosage.summary: Hyaluronic acid vaginal gel doses were adjusted by animal weight according to human dosage.
